official-title.#text:
To amend the Investment Advisers Act of 1940 to provide a
		  registration exemption for private equity fund advisers, and for other
		  purposes.

cosponsor.#tail:
) introduced the following
			 bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Small Business Capital Access and Job
			 Preservation Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 203 of the Investment Advisers Act
			 of 1940

header.#text:
Registration and
			 reporting exemptions relating to private equity funds advisors

Exemption of and
				reporting requirements by private equity funds advisors

text.#text:
Except as provided in
				this subsection, no investment adviser shall be subject to the registration or
				reporting requirements of this title with respect to the provision of
				investment advice relating to a private equity fund or funds, provided that
				each such fund has not borrowed and does not have outstanding a principal
				amount in excess of twice its invested capital commitments.

header.#text:
Maintenance of
				records and access by Commission

text.#text:
Not later than 6 months after
				the date of enactment of this subsection, the Commission shall issue final
				rules—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to maintain such records and
				provide to the
such annual or other reports as the

taking
				into account fund size, governance, investment strategy, risk, and other
				factors, as the

determines necessary and appropriate in the public
				interest and for the protection of investors; and

text.#text:
to require
				investment advisers described in
